body_html:
Also, I'm a little confused about the exact semantics of torch.save() and torch.load(). Do they operate properly on pytorch objects nested in other data structures? Eg. will

torch.save([pytorch_model1, pytorch_model2, {'asdf': pytorch_model3}], PATH)
stuff = torch.load(PATH)

work correctly?
body_text:
Also, I'm a little confused about the exact semantics of torch.save() and torch.load(). Do they operate properly on pytorch objects nested in other data structures? Eg. will
torch.save([pytorch_model1, pytorch_model2, {'asdf': pytorch_model3}], PATH)
stuff = torch.load(PATH)
work correctly?
body:
Also, I'm a little confused about the exact semantics of `torch.save()` and `torch.load()`. Do they operate properly on pytorch objects nested in other data structures? Eg. will

```python
torch.save([pytorch_model1, pytorch_model2, {'asdf': pytorch_model3}], PATH)
stuff = torch.load(PATH)
```

work correctly?
